== Introduction ==
Edgy, all about cutting edge, perhaps bleeding edge, will consist of brand new code and infrastructure. The time has come to introduce some seriously interesting, but definitely edgy, new technologies that lay the groundwork for the next wave of Ubuntu development.

Knot CD 3 is the third in a series of milestone CD images that will be released throughout the Edgy development cycle as images known to be reasonably free of CD-build or installer bugs. They represent very current snapshots of Edgy. Kubuntu Edgy Knot releases can be downloaded from the following URL:
* http://cdimage.ubuntu.com/kubuntu/releases/edgy/knot-3/

'''NOTE:''' ''This is an alpha (pre-) release. Pre-release versions of Edgy are '''__NOT__''' encouraged for anyone needing a stable system or not comfortable running into occasional, even frequent, breakage. Pre-release versions of Edgy '''__ARE__''' recommended for Ubuntu developers and those who want to help in testing, reporting, and fixing bugs.''

=== Upstart ===
'''Info:''' http://upstart.ubuntu.com <<BR>>

Upstart, an event-based replacement for the <code>/sbin/init</code> daemon, handles the starting of tasks and services during boot, stopping them during shutdown, and supervising them while the system is running. With the Ubuntu distribution currently at mind, it is also being developed to be suitable for deployment in all Linux distributions as a replacement for the <code>sysvinit</code> package.<<BR>>

'''Highlights'''
* Tasks and Services are started and stopped by events
* Events are generated as tasks and services are run and stopped
* Events may also be generated at timed intervals, or when files are changed
* Events may be received from any other process on the system
* Services may be respawned if they die unexpectedly
* Bi-directional communication with init daemon to discover which jobs are running, why jobs failed, etc.
For more information, please view the <nowiki>[[http://upstart.ubuntu.com|Upstart Website]]</nowiki>.

=== Amarok 1.4.3 ===
{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <tablestyle="float: right" style="border: 0 none black"><nowiki>[[File:amarok.png]]</nowiki>
|}
'''''KMenu -> Multimedia'''''<<BR>>
'''Info:''' http://amarok.kde.org <<BR>>

New in Knot 3 is the ''bug-fix'' release of Amarok, version 1.4.3. However, bugs were not the only things worked on with this release. There have been a few new features added, some nice changes, and of course some minor bug fixes. Here is a brief breakdown:<<BR>><<BR>>
'''Features'''
* New DCOP: player trackCurrentTimeMs, returns the current track position in milliseconds.
* Amarok File Tracking (Formerly ATF) goes public
* DAAP client now supports Zeroconf. With mDNSResponder properly setup, Amarok automatically shows local DAAP servers.
* DAAP client saves manually added computers between sessions.
'''Changes'''
* Performance with big play lists has been improved greatly also making the application shutdown faster.
* Remove the option to enable/disable history in dynamic mode
* Reduce the minimum available tracks to show to 0
Interested in more changes and the bug fixes? Then read the full <nowiki>[[http://amarok.kde.org/content/view/81/66/|1.4.3 Release Notes]]</nowiki>.<<BR>><<BR>>

=== Konversation 1 ===
{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <tablestyle="float: right" style="border: 0 none black"><nowiki>[[File:konversation.png]]</nowiki>
|}
'''''KMenu -> Internet'''''<<BR>>
'''Info:''' http://konversation.kde.org <<BR>><<BR>>

Konversation is the default graphical Internet Relay Chat client (IRC) in Kubuntu. The previous version of Konversation in Kubuntu Dapper and Edgy (Knot 2 and prior) was 0.19. Since then, many changes have taken place, laying the foundation for an amazing graphical IRC client. There have been hundreds of changes in this new release. The following is a brief introduction to these changes:<<BR>><<BR>>
'''User Interface'''
* Tree View - You can now place you server and channel tabs on the left hand side of the window. Refer to the image to the right.
* Mode and topic handling in the Channel Settings dialog and the channel mode buttons have been overhauled to make them more reliable.
* Remember lines - can be optionally  setup to insert a remember line whenever a tab is hidden, either by switching to a different tab or minimizing the window.
'''Commands'''
* "Now Playing" script invoked via <code>/media</code> command now features support for XMMS and KSCD as well as improved support for Amarok.
* New <code>/hop</code> and <code>/dehop</code> commands to grant or remove half-op status from a user have been added.
* You may now use <code>%nick</code> as a placeholder for your own nickname in the auto- connect commands for a network
Other changes have occurred to DCC and Technology infrastructures as well. To read more about these changes, as well as hundreds of other changes, please read the <nowiki>[[http://konversation.kde.org|release notes]]</nowiki> on the front page.<<BR>><<BR>>

=== KTorrent 2.0.1 ===

'''''KMenu -> Internet'''''<<BR>>
'''Info:''' http://ktorrent.org <<BR>><<BR>>

KTorrent is the default BitTorrent program for Kubuntu. Version 2.0.1 is the first bug release for the 2.0 release. The 2.0 release adds several big new features to KTorrent:
* Support for distributed hash tables
* Protocol encryptions
* Bandwidth scheduling
* Directory Scanner to automatically load torrents in certain directories
* Trackers can now be added to torrents
* File precedency for multi file torrents
There have also been quite a few bug fixes as well. To read more about the fixes and changes, please read the <nowiki>[[http://ktorrent.org|release notes]]</nowiki> on the front page.<<BR>><<BR>>
